data.text:
810+ million people worldwide go to bed hungry every night. The majority of these people live in countries affected by conflict & violence.

On Monday's #SolidarityDay, learn how @WFP is harnessing the strength of solidarity to achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/IYY1h66wiB https://t.co/i83xhasMTr

UN peacekeepers come from different countries, cultures & backgrounds, but share a common purpose: to improve lives and further peace around the world.

More on the important protection work of @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/1AkYG74EeJ https://t.co/8BelQGORI7

In 2022, 274 million people around the world will need humanitarian assistance.

The Global Humanitarian Overview highlights the urgent need to #InvestInHumanity.

More from @UNOCHA: https://t.co/mpbqI9DzrY #GHO2022 https://t.co/4Cqf8B7QKe

"We know how to make 2022 a happier and more hopeful new year. We must do all it takes to make it happen."

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for global solidarity to address the multitude of challenges facing the world in the new year. https://t.co/DJjYQuSFjt https://t.co/qxXzDBQjNN

The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted the key role migrant workers play in the global economy, as well as the risks they are forced to take to find work.

Latest from @UNMigration. https://t.co/ciQRT701pj

During difficult times, it is completely normal to feel anxious, isolated or overwhelmed with work, family responsibilities or life in general.

Exercise 🏃
Eat well 🥗
Get enough sleep 😴
& more can all improve mental health. 

https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB via @UN_Women https://t.co/kQ61BbU5Pk

#YearInReview: In November, actor & environmentalist @Maisie_Williams took part in a #ClimateAction conversation with youth activists from #COP26 in Glasgow.

See how you can join Maisie and #ActNow to help protect our planet: https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/A8zOERLzYm

As she prepares to leave her position at the end of the year, UN Human Rights President @nazhatskhan reflects on her time with the Council, including its important role in addressing challenges such as #COVID19 and the climate crisis. https://t.co/2FlBDJBlWu

Racism, discrimination and xenophobia harm us all.

But everyone, everywhere can take action to spread compassion, tolerance and acceptance.

Get ideas about how YOU can help #FightRacism. https://t.co/lmBLVk3qxU https://t.co/YzwnRuOmIq

“What's still shocking to me is that we know. We can't claim ignorance or uncertainty about what's happening on climate. But yet, we're not doing enough.”

UN #ClimateAction Adviser @SelwinHart shares what keeps him 'Awake At Night' with @MelissaFleming. https://t.co/it3LJtU9Sl https://t.co/bVqjlyxdD6

"We need more effective international cooperation and a more compassionate approach to migration."

-- @antonioguterres on Saturday's #MigrantsDay. https://t.co/sgbvNCsWU2 https://t.co/MA0uMPlirl

Strengthening national capacity to develop, maintain & manage a safe, secure & humane prison system is an integral part of UN efforts to build peace & prevent relapse into conflict. https://t.co/2V8926mdoF https://t.co/mSOkvr7xJJ

1 in every 30 people in the 🌍 is a migrant.

Saturday's #MigrantsDay is an opportunity to celebrate the millions of migrants that are integral members of the societies in which they live, and their contributions to both their home & host countries. 

https://t.co/e2dAYeQ2fZ https://t.co/rRYr5jBiPb

Happy World #ArabicLanguageDay!

Spoken by more than 400 million people, the Arabic language is one of the most widely used languages in the world. 

It's also considered a pillar of cultural diversity. https://t.co/4P2nnXVYVL https://t.co/6jZgSjr2md

🧠Knowledge
⚙️Skills
📈Economic growth
🤝Unity

These contributions from migrants help build stronger and more resilient societies.

More on Saturday's #MigrantsDay. https://t.co/WCLYbgTUVo via @UNmigration https://t.co/61VHsFWMzc

Saturday is World #ArabicLanguageDay! 

Follow the United Nations in Arabic via @UNArabic and learn more about the day here: https://t.co/sjLbvgERdd https://t.co/Gj0cPJUim3

Migrants have made significant contributions in fighting #COVID19, often on the frontlines of the global response to the pandemic.

On Saturday's #MigrantsDay join us in thanking migrants for their contributions! https://t.co/WCLYbgCjwO https://t.co/QkhnCLn1Xw

Ethiopia: Alleged severe human rights violations and abuses should be investigated, says UN Human Right Council.

400,000+ people in Tigray now living in famine-like conditions, with limited access to humanitarian relief. https://t.co/RgQC0t7Zvm

We are stronger together. 

On Monday's #SolidarityDay, and every day, let's celebrate the role of human solidarity in building lives of dignity and peace for all. https://t.co/uRASjvGxWA https://t.co/L9DDhcsTA3

The #TrollsFoodHeroes have teamed up with the UN to help build a more sustainable world.

You can join them & take #ClimateAction by reducing your food waste: 
🗓 Plan your meals
🥙 Eat leftovers
❄️ Freeze excess food
🌱 Compost

More ways to #ActNow: https://t.co/dDZ0DfgqGw https://t.co/qR0M64DuMI

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The survival of animals, the frequency of disasters, the spread of diseases & more hinge on these few degrees.

We need #ClimateAction now. https://t.co/yUfFWZlUJS via @UNFCCC https://t.co/1sVhs3ETSc

"Let's join hands together so that we can work towards a better tomorrow."

-- @BTS_twt shared a message of hope with @MelissaFleming while taking part in this September's #UNGA. #YearInReview https://t.co/vWx2HgcUSH

Democratic Republic of the Congo: Latest Ebola outbreak in North Kivu Province that began in October is officially over. 

@WHO says stronger disease surveillance, community engagement & targeted vaccinations helped contain the outbreak. https://t.co/l6xHqiZzJ8

Home is where we should all feel safest. But for many women, that is not a reality. Amid #COVID19, domestic abuse has surged.

Watch as UN women leaders discuss the impacts of violence against women & girls around the world and how to end it. https://t.co/ATGU4g1NF6 https://t.co/vAA8S1800Q

"We know how to make 2022 a happier and more hopeful new year. We must do all it takes to make it happen."

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for global solidarity to address the pressing challenges facing the world in the year ahead. https://t.co/R2iUgDHPfz

Over the last 40 years, the UN Torture Fund provided direct assistance to more than 1.2 million survivors of torture. 

Learn how the Fund is helping survivors access rehabilitation services and redress. https://t.co/CqAUvsuL5T https://t.co/jOhNvoGjyp

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 

Biking to work 🚴‍♀️
Switching off lights 💡
Reducing food waste 🚮
& more!

Chat with us over Facebook messenger to get more tips on how you can #ActNow to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/mezgw4BZ4q https://t.co/MHBEPrAuNc

The UN's emergency response fund helps ensure fast and flexible funding is available to people in need -- anytime & anywhere. 

See how @UNCERF helped save lives this year. ⬇️ https://t.co/fNCUIlaInW

Reduce all forms of violence.
End abuse, exploitation & trafficking.
Develop effective, accountable institutions.

Peace, justice & strong institutions are key to sustainable development and prosperity. Learn more: https://t.co/6gN3jh9LNV #GlobalGoals https://t.co/O90Xu7KlIY

South Sudan: Top UN official in the country calls for renewed political will and trust to avoid a state of paralysis -- or in a worst-case scenario -- a total collapse of fragile peace agreement. https://t.co/9x5LA5q1j7

The Omicron variant is likely spreading in most of the world’s countries, head of @WHO has said.

@DRTedros warns that the newest strain of #COVID19 should not be dismissed & precautionary measures must be taken. https://t.co/JTAXZRZtBx

Yemen: A #COVID19 vaccination campaign is underway, aiming to reach 7,500 displaced migrants.

@UNmigration says immunizing people on the move is key to ending the pandemic, but greater support is needed to ensure enough vaccines are available. https://t.co/iDikxnsuU3

"There is simply no viable alternative."

Briefing the Security Council on developments surrounding the Iran nuclear deal, @UNDPPA Chief @DicarloRosemary says effort & patience will be needed as negotiations take place in Vienna. https://t.co/Jg9vaqeCOd

Myanmar continues to face a humanitarian crisis with more than 500K people displaced from their homes.

As #COVID19 and armed conflict disrupt daily life, @Refugees is working to provide life-saving aid to those in need. https://t.co/txP18fxPw1 https://t.co/z2xJHmKkGq

Afghanistan: 8.7 million people are on the brink of famine due to on-going conflict, drought and economic uncertainties.

See how @WFP plans to help those in need. https://t.co/vcGACScRmR
 https://t.co/MrLmDNFFDU

"Let us choose to prioritize children - all children, especially those affected by armed conflict."

Virginia Gamba, UN special representative for @childreninwar, reflects on the past 25 years of her office's important work to protect children.
https://t.co/AMGUcw8RtJ

“Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.”

This past year, @UNStamps honoured the life and legacy of Nobel laureate Mother Teresa by releasing a new set of commemorative stamps. Get yours here: https://t.co/P5rNpTt2LH #YearInReview https://t.co/HsJor84ozD

"Global challenges, such as climate change & the #COVID19 pandemic, require us to work together."

-- @UNECOSOC President is committed to strengthening multilateralism & increasing ambition for sustainable development & #ClimateAction. https://t.co/MKbaDHl6df https://t.co/rDuIftMK2H

People around the world are calling for urgent steps to address the climate emergency.

Here are 10 global events scheduled for 2022 that will be crucial for #ClimateAction.   
https://t.co/T382qoWRaq

Congratulations to the #UNPublicServiceAwards winners for 2021 and 2020! 

Get inspired by these winning initiatives from around the world to advance the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/sEw8BHpcbT via @UNDESA  https://t.co/IFwazjnqnX

"Omicron or not, vaccines remain our key weapon in this fight. 

If doses are lacking, we share. If trust is lacking, we win it back." 

-- @MelissaFleming on the importance of countering #COVID19 misinformation & ensuring vaccine equity. https://t.co/Rute3Z0CqQ

A new exhibit at UNHQ tells the first-hand stories of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki and exemplifies the 70+ year efforts to achieve a world free of nuclear weapons.

Learn more: https://t.co/fsuAihsHq4 https://t.co/rny3Aljh2y

Corruption can spread through societies, eroding people’s trust in leaders & institutions while reinforcing inequalities.

@UNODC is calling for governments to mobilize the necessary resources to battle corruption, including at the highest levels. https://t.co/b5bQftrgdh

$835 million needed to provide life-saving health services to people in crises in the coming year, says @UNFPA.

Aid will help reach more than 54 million women, girls & young people amid challenges posed by conflict and #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/S9gQd2AfT8

For decades, the UN has helped protect children caught in situations of armed conflict from grave violations and hostilities 

This work remains as important as ever. https://t.co/wv9WrQKUa5 via @childreninwar https://t.co/vuQtVkc1cs

For 70 years, @UNmigration has been providing critical aid to migrants, promoting safe & regular migration and harnessing the potential of human mobility.

More about IOM's work for people on the move: https://t.co/d9ApqfMy2X

 https://t.co/a1FSvSqqxa

It's time to:
🔴 End fossil fuels subsidies.
🔴 Phase out coal. 
🔴 Put a price on carbon.
🔴 Build resilience in communities vulnerable to the impacts of the climate crisis.

More about the urgent need for #ClimateAction: https://t.co/B5yXlTjM5b via @UNEP https://t.co/SS1Zyj2WPQ

Families in Afghanistan are facing a devastating winter ahead.
The economic crisis is putting essential food out of reach, resulting in a severe rise in acute malnutrition among young children.
Here's how @WFP is helping. https://t.co/vcGACScRmR https://t.co/BxIWrvDp68

We can all do our part to #FightRacism.

📖 EDUCATE yourself on the many ways racism hurts society.
💭 REFLECT on concrete solutions to eradicate it.
🌱 CULTIVATE values of tolerance throughout your communities.

More ideas: https://t.co/PWxqEMAxTC https://t.co/XFMe5eXwLZ

The Trolls are teaming up with the UN to help build a healthier planet.

🍊🌽🫐🥕🍌🥦

From eating more fruits & vegetables to reducing food waste, learn how you can join the #TrollsFoodHeroes: https://t.co/dDZ0DfgqGw #ActNow https://t.co/oTKEMK0jaM

UNHQ in NYC is open to the public again. 

You can #VisitUN and take a guided tour with one of our multi-lingual guides if you are fully vaccinated and have pre-booked your ticket here: https://t.co/WEXzZylDPQ https://t.co/rj4metFcem

"Something like this cannot happen again."

On Awake At Night, @iaeaorg chief @RafaelMGrossi, who has been working on non-proliferation for 35+ years, recounts how Hiroshima survivors gave him the determination to ensure history doesn’t repeat itself. https://t.co/Y2mHCkIPHq https://t.co/Q2RwuTNOzt

Institutions need not remain passive - they can fight back. 

They might not eliminate misinformation, but at least they will give the truth a fighting chance.

-- @MelissaFleming & @jeremyheimans in @TheEconomist on countering #COVID19 misinformation: https://t.co/xUOGv77Wpn

Ending the #COVID19 crisis and building a safer and healthier future requires investing in health systems that protect all people, everywhere. 

On Sunday's Universal Health Coverage Day, join @WHO in calling for #HealthForAll https://t.co/C3vLXO6sHX https://t.co/1uWkqw4d17

As #COVID19 continues to spread, it's more important than ever that we work together to reduce transmission of the virus. 

Follow these tips to stay safe and protect your loved ones.

Get more Verified information: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/WU196KWq0y

Health is a human right, yet inequalities in access to health care persist. 

Countries & providers must ensure:
🩺 Free & equal access
🩺 End to discrimination
🩺 Safe & healthy environment 

More on #HealthForAll on Sunday's Universal Health Coverage Day https://t.co/mrSK6qpmmQ

#Health4All means primary health care that:
➡️ is affordable & closer to communities 🏠
➡️ protects against disease 🦠 
➡️ empowers people to live healthy lives 🏃🚴

@WHO has more on Sunday's Universal Health Coverage Day: https://t.co/C3vLXOo46x

The UN provides impartial mediation to prevent & de-escalate conflict. 

More on Sunday's International Neutrality Day: https://t.co/J0nbpom1es https://t.co/Rpwcgu6YFk

To address the climate crisis, we need to decrease our use of oil, coal & gas.

Phasing out fossil fuels will improve our health & that of the planet. 

More fast facts about the urgent need for #ClimateAction: https://t.co/J9e34qcWgR https://t.co/orDFlCxRri

Up to USD$ 1.7 trillion is wagered on illicit betting markets each year. 

New @UNODC global report offers a playbook to effectively tackle crime & corruption in sport. https://t.co/IWBCdPLiaX https://t.co/qHvgLf0DiE

Whoever they are, wherever they live, all children deserve a childhood, a future and a fair chance. 

For 75 years, @UNICEF has worked #ForEveryChild, everywhere. https://t.co/CgKkL6OYtS #UNICEF75 https://t.co/8aA6ViO7dp

Sustainable tourism can help preserve the cultural heritage of mountain peoples and destinations. 🌄

Learn about why #MountainsMatter for us all on Saturday's International Mountain Day. https://t.co/2kj4sW9L6b https://t.co/HEmMCwUUr3

New @GEMReport shows that many countries lack adequate regulations on private education or the capacity to enforce them. 

This undermines quality & widens the educational divide between rich & poor. https://t.co/5pAn0i28Ub https://t.co/Xtd9ZqbzBl

Mountains cover more than 25% of the earth's land surface and are home to over 1 billion people. 

Yet, they are increasingly under threat due to the climate crisis.

Learn more from @FAO about why #MountainsMatter on Saturday's International Mountain Day. https://t.co/xzEPmA8D9R https://t.co/0wgc92ZKx5

The #TrollsFoodHeroes have joined forces with the UN to help build a more sustainable world.

By eating all kinds fruits & vegetables – including "ugly" ones – you can improve your health & help reduce food waste.

More ways you can #ActNow: https://t.co/dDZ0DeYPhW https://t.co/TckYt7z8TF

More than 45,000 people have lost their lives while migrating since 2014, almost 4,500 of them this year alone. 

@UNMigration urges countries to develop policies and practices to reduce the risks that many people on the move are forced to take. https://t.co/RWor1lW5AI

Myanmar: @UNHumanRights appalled by alarming escalation of grave human rights abuses, calling for firm, unified & resolute international response that redoubles efforts to pursue accountability for military and restoration of democracy in the country.
https://t.co/W9sS2PnMAX

This holiday season, Rome's Christmas tree display includes special gift packages: the #GlobalGoals.

From #ZeroHunger to #ClimateAction,  all of them are linked to steps we can take to build a better future. https://t.co/SmIW4obZiT via @FAO

 https://t.co/PxtjgmpEIx

The Universal Declaration of Human Rights has helped improve the lives of millions of people and lay the foundations for a more just world.

#StandUp4HumanRights on #HumanRightsDay & every day.  https://t.co/2ftXxLSUoQ https://t.co/y5vXHmCjtJ

Violence against women & girls is a human rights violation that is pervasive, but not inevitable.

As the #16Days of activism wrap up, see how the UN joined people around the world in calling for an end to gender-based violence. https://t.co/cQALzs02QF

"Today and every day, we will continue to work for justice, equality, dignity and human rights for all."

-- UN Secretary-General António Guterres on Friday's #HumanRightsDay. https://t.co/JGN0GN4A29 https://t.co/5rXzBE7530

"What were you wearing?" 

A new exhibit by @RiseNowUS & @GlobalSpotlight at UNHQ features outfits worn by survivors of sexual assault - seeking to remove some of the stigma & blame they often face. https://t.co/fsuAihb61u #16Days https://t.co/ThWuEJtAms

The freedoms enshrined in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights remain as relevant as ever.

They must be at the centre of efforts to recover better from the pandemic & ensure we leave no one behind.

More on Friday's #HumanRightsDay: https://t.co/lPElW0bdTy https://t.co/GAggOJ74Xo

Female genital mutilation is a human rights violation that prevents girls and women from realizing their rights and full potential. 

Join @UN_women in calling for concrete actions to end this harmful practice that has no medical justification. https://t.co/arcZV93gY0 #16days https://t.co/KmPNikl8Qw

#COVID19 has highlighted inequalities around the world.

The core principles of human rights must be at the centre of the pandemic recovery efforts:

➡️Equality 
➡️Dignity
➡️Inclusivity

More on Friday's #HumanRightsDay: https://t.co/m1atSwDVOb #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/JjAcOjcWcM

We are facing a lost decade for kids. 

But this is not the time to give up. 
It is a chance to reimagine a world where every child gets a fair chance.

@UNICEF calls for action to address the biggest crisis for children in their 75-year history. https://t.co/sSAaCyAxwp #UNICEF75 https://t.co/tyN9lBO5J5

"The United Nations is proud to stand with you to build a safer & more sustainable future for all."

-- @antonioguterres tells Security Council, urging all countries to work simultaneously on peacebuilding & addressing the effects of the climate crisis. https://t.co/fY8jbibtwa https://t.co/8KHd8fFXDT

Photographers from around the world have shared powerful images of human rights at work as part of the #Photography4Humanity exhibit. 

See their work and get inspired to #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/Fc7tYybMBJ https://t.co/V8MwyxERlR

Corruption amid #COVID19 can erode human rights & increase inequalities, while also disproportionately impacting the most vulnerable.

Thursday's International Anti-Corruption Day is an opportunity to say #NoToCorruption.  https://t.co/NDUlGTGMJT via @UNODC https://t.co/LazQa2PDvk

"By working together, we can avoid the egregious mistakes of the past."

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's #PreventGenocide Day. https://t.co/DekLGooGPX https://t.co/pPlRJYfz8p

Corruption uniquely impacts women, resulting in: 
➡️ their exclusion in decision-making roles,
➡️ increased negative stereotypes,
➡️ reduced economic power & education opportunities.

Thursday is International Anti-Corruption Day. https://t.co/NDUlGTGMJT via @UNODC https://t.co/5O2gQfjBRE

Thursday's International Anti-Corruption Day is an opportunity for all of us to reflect on our rights and responsibilities when it comes to saying #NoToCorruption. 

More from @UNODC. https://t.co/NDUlGTGMJT https://t.co/EfYbl8c8iJ

Each of us can call out harassment when we see it: 
❌Abuse
❌Catcalling
❌Sexist jokes
❌Unwelcome behaviour
❌Inappropriate sexual comments

Take action during the #16Days to end gender-based violence. https://t.co/REld6vxu8p via @UN_Women https://t.co/hqFoFfciPF

The UN climate conference #COP26 wrapped up last month in Glasgow, but what #ClimateAction steps were announced? What will happen next? And what exactly does it all mean for our future?

Check out the answers to those questions & more: https://t.co/EQwt43i8Kr https://t.co/etXCztMLMv

For more than seven decades, brave women & men have been #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping. 

This week, countries came together to show their support for their efforts to protect some of the world's most vulnerable people. https://t.co/EsFLz6WLlt #PKMinisterial https://t.co/V9FEKXLrH4

Millions of children around the world are suffering from the impacts of #COVID19, on-going conflicts and natural disasters.

@UNICEF has launched an emergency appeal to reach the most vulnerable children and families with life-saving support. https://t.co/W0zi6aSe7b

Escalating violence in Sudan's Darfur region has displaced thousands of people since November.

The UN is working to provide emergency assistance, but warns that 6.2 million people will need humanitarian aid in the upcoming year. https://t.co/ajfTUmqzhc

12 million girls are forced into marriage before they reach the age of 18. 

During these #16Days of activism to end gender-based violence, join @UNFPA in speaking out against this human rights violation and help #ENDChildMarriage. https://t.co/UyRhZTV5I6 https://t.co/Cgl7m4wDaO

Saving people’s lives cannot wait for political solutions — unless conflicts are solved millions of people will continue to be exposed to uncertainty and fear, and forced displacement will grow.

-- @Refugees Chief @FilippoGrandi tells Security Council. https://t.co/s7kcXPhZDl https://t.co/IXAN3xl9ft

As the world faces the highest number of violent conflicts since 1945, @antonioguterres tells #PKMinisterial meeting that @UNPeacekeeping has never been more relevant and its success more urgent. https://t.co/x4hnIS63EN

Congratulations to the 2021 Champions of the Earth for receiving the UN’s highest environmental honour!

Find out more about the new #EarthChamps & their #GenerationRestoration work from @UNEP. https://t.co/DPKlVlTxZ1 https://t.co/2hKFpeycyq
